title: Steve Madden confident despite Q2 profit fall
text:
Q2 profit falls 12.5% to $24.5m Sales up 9.4% to $323.6m Company confident of achieving 2015 targets 
US footwear and accessories specialist Steve Madden has reported a better-than-expected performance in the second quarter, despite posting a 12.5% decline in net profit. 
Net income amounted to US$24.5m for the three months to 30 June, compared to $28m in the same period last year. Gross margin slipped to 35.9% from 36.2%. 
Sales grew 9.4% to $323.6m from $295.7m, with retail net sales rising 24% to $56.9m from $45.9m and comparable store sales up 18.5%. Wholesale sales increased 6.8% to $266.7m from $249.8m a year ago. 
&quotWe are pleased to have delivered sales and earnings results ahead of expectations in the second quarter," said chairman and CEO Edward Rosenfeld. 
The company expects full-year sales to grow 7-9% year-on-year, and diluted earnings per share to range from $1.85 to $1.95. 
Rosenfeld added: &quotBased on the improvement in the underlying trends in our business, we are confident in our ability to achieve our sales and earnings targets for 2015."
